page.title: 02Nanjizel Cove, St. Levan
page.content: by Trevor Angove. {There is something special about {Nanjizel.}Stand at the top of the last slope and{let your imagination roam. The solitary, wild, rugged cliffs and ever restless sea{create a magic place {where time itself seems part of some {other universe.}Caves abound where a pixie may still be hiding, guarding a smuggled horde. At home in thunderous breakers{an Atlantic Seal watches with {a curious, remote gaze,}while a fulmar sweeps by on motionless wings; or a buzzard soars along an updraught. In {winter,}metres deep{under a frothy {merinque of storm driven foam; summer, lazy under a sultry hot sun,{with the {sea a somnolent background.}Nanjizel is a place for dreams,{an echo drawing {me back to ponder on a day of eternity or into the future,{waiting to refresh {the spirit of a world weary traveller.
